intro: Phlojodicarpus nudiusculus var. major, commonly known as the giant sea holly, is a unique marine plant found in shallow coastal waters. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant thrives in intertidal zones, where it can tolerate periodic submersion and exposure to saltwater. Its root system helps stabilize sediments, contributing to coastal ecosystem health. The species is notable for its ability to store water, enabling it to survive in fluctuating environmental conditions.
